answers.answer: I've had three inductions. None of mine took as long as yours. Was you already dilated when they started or did they use a cervix softener to prepare you for the induction?  My first one I was already dilated 2 cm but my other two they had me come in the night before and put in this thing that is on a tampon like string and it has a medicine to soften the cervix then the next morning they take it out and start the pitocen. If your cervix doesn't fully soften it can cause the labor to be much harder and increases your bleeding risk. Talk to your doctor and discuss your concerns about your last induction and see if there is anything more they can do to prevent it from happening again.
